content.user_title: Create interactive charts with Plotly for scientific data
content.value_statement: You need clear, interactive visualizations for scientific and statistical data. This skill provides guidance on using Plotly Express and graph objects to build, style, and export professional charts for reports and dashboards.
actual_capabilities: Guide chart selection across 40+ Plotly chart types including scatter, line, bar, heatmap, 3D, and maps
Explain when to use Plotly Express versus graph objects for different use cases
Show layout, styling, template, and subplot configuration options
Detail interactivity features including hover tooltips, zoom, pan, and selection tools
Describe export to interactive HTML and static image formats like PNG, PDF, SVG
limitations: Does not execute code or render charts directly
Requires Plotly installation and optional Kaleido for static image export
Does not perform data cleaning, transformation, or statistical analysis
Mapbox map styles may require a separate access token

use_cases.title: Exploratory visualizations
use_cases.description: Select the right Plotly chart type and add trendlines, facets, and custom hover details.

use_cases.title: Publication figures
use_cases.description: Apply precise styling, annotations, and export to SVG or PDF for academic papers.

use_cases.title: Interactive dashboards
use_cases.description: Build multi-plot figures and prepare visuals for Dash apps or HTML reports.

prompt_templates.title: Basic scatter plot
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Plotly Express scatter plot from a pandas DataFrame with x, y columns and a title.

prompt_templates.title: Styled time series
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a time series line chart with rangeslider, custom axis titles, and a dark template.

prompt_templates.title: Custom multi-trace
prompt_templates.prompt: Use graph objects to build a figure with two traces, a custom legend, and an annotation arrow.

prompt_templates.title: Export workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to export an interactive HTML file with CDN reference and a PNG using Kaleido settings.

output_examples.input: Create a scatter plot with a trendline and export to PNG
output: Use Plotly Express scatter with trendline='ols' to add an ordinary least squares regression line.
Install Kaleido package, then call fig.write_image('chart.png') to export.
Keep labels and title readable by using appropriate font sizes for reports.

best_practices: Start with Plotly Express for quick charts, then refine with graph objects methods
Use built-in templates like plotly_white or plotly_dark to keep styling consistent
Export to HTML for interactivity and PNG, SVG, or PDF for static sharing in reports
anti_patterns: Using low-level graph objects for simple one-line charts when Plotly Express suffices
Attempting image export without installing Kaleido or having Chromium available
Ignoring axis labels, titles, and hover details which reduces chart clarity in scientific work

faq.question: What Python versions are supported?
faq.answer: This skill targets Plotly for Python; check Plotly documentation for your Python version compatibility.

faq.question: Are there limits on chart types?
faq.answer: The guidance covers 40+ chart types available in Plotly Express and graph objects combined.

faq.question: Can I integrate with Dash web applications?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill includes guidance for using Plotly figures inside Dash layouts and callbacks.

faq.question: Does the skill access my data or files?
faq.answer: No, this is a documentation skill that provides guidance only without accessing local files.

faq.question: Why does static image export fail?
faq.answer: Install the Kaleido package and ensure Chromium or Chrome is available on your system.

faq.question: How does Plotly compare to Matplotlib?
faq.answer: Plotly focuses on interactive charts with web outputs, while Matplotlib excels at static publication figures.
